question.text: Ms. Ripola is___an accountant when totaling the receipts.

answer.explanation: (C) Equal comparisons require as on both sides of the adjective. Choice (A) omits the first “as”. Choice (B) omits the second “as”. Choice (D) uses “than”.

question.text: Contributions to our global education ___ will be instrumental in establishing learning opportunities for individuals all over the world.
___the seminar, the audience had trouble hearing the speaker.

answer.explanation: (B) “During” is logical and is used with noun phrases. Choice (A) is not logical. Choices (C) and (D) are used to introduce clauses, not noun phrases.

question.text: The institution’s ability to meet its ___ growth levels wil! depend on the commitment of all staff.
Reductions in the budget require us___our costs for international travel.

answer.explanation: (B) “Require” is followed by an infinitive verb. Choice (A) is present tense. Choice (C) is a gerund. Choice (D) is base form.

question.text: Some officials still need ___ of the importance of separate playing fields for young football and baseball players.
Wyncote Airlines has announced that it will ___ the £15 baggage fee for members of its Sky Flyer Club.
___ all the candidates applying for the job, Mr. Wang appears to be the most promising.

answer.explanation:
"Between" is only used when there are two things.
There is a superlative adjective used as a noun in the sentence so we use "of" all.

question.text: Dr. Ravia has made significant contributions to the fields of psychology and neurobiology ___ his earlier work in linguistics.

answer.explanation:
"In addition to" is used to mention another thing after st else.
We use"inasmuch as" instead of "in as much as".
In the event of = In case of
"In either case" goes with a comma.

question.text: Hiring temporary workers can be very___.

answer.explanation: (D) “Economical” is an adjective used to modify the subject “hiring”. Choice (A) is a verb. Choice (B) is an adverb. Choice (C) is a noun.
